sources.title: Improper accounting costs Park $500,000 civil penalty - The Advocate
sources.snippet: The SEC imposed a $500,000 civil penalty on Park National for improper accounting for loan losses. The loan losses occurred at former Park subsidiary, Florida-based Vision Bank, in 2010 and 2011.

sources.title: Justice Department Secures $9 Million from Park National Bank to ...
sources.snippet: The Justice Department announced today a $9 million agreement to resolve allegations that Park National Bank (Park National), headquartered in Newark, Ohio, engaged in a pattern or practice of lending discrimination by "redlining" in the Columbus metropolitan area. The agreement is part of the Justice Department's nationwide Combating Redlining Initiative that Attorney General Merrick B ...

sources.title: United States v. Park National Bank (S.D. Ohio)

sources.title: Utah AG announces settlement with dialysis company over monopoly concerns
sources.snippet: SALT LAKE CITY (ABC4) - Utah Attorney General Sean D. Reyes announced a settlement with DaVita, Inc., a dialysis service provider over antitrust concerns. This settlement comes on the heels of DaVita's acquisition of the University of Utah's entire kidney dialysis business which consists of 18 clinics and other assets.
